page.title: 09TRANSPORT in King Lud's area
page.content: Public transport is very limited in the rural areas and tends to be limited to the roads joining villages. School children are taken out of the area to school by bus from collection points which can often be arranged by individual parents. The main road, A607, which joins Melton Mowbray with Grantham passes through the north west corner of the area. This road is extensively used by heavy transport throughout the year, and is especially busy in summer when used by holiday-makers driving to and from the east coast holiday resorts.
